really good explanation sir! i finally got this and from the other linked video i also understand why the two eigenvalues have to result in a determinant of zero (as the modified transformation matrix projects all points onto the other eigenvector since you scale the current eigenvector to a length of zero. because the determinant gives the area spanned by the two eigenvectors and an area of 0 means one eigenvector has to be of length zero and all other points will be projected to the other non-zero-length-eigenvektor (in the literature these eigenvectors are called loadings and they gives the direction of a principal component and all the projected points are the scores )
